CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Three donor - acceptor type of narrow band gap conjugated polymers with enlarged coplanar skeleton were synthesized via Stille copolymerization of indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) based monomers. The energy levels , absorption spectra and band gaps of the resulting polymers were well tuned by utilizing different thiophene derivatives as spacer between IDT and NT units , and polymer PIDT-C12NT which employed bithiophene attached with dodecyl side chain as spacer exhibited superior properties compared to the other two copolymers. All polymers exhibited deep highest occupied molecular orbital energy levels and subsequently lead to high open circuit voltages of fabricated solar cell devices. Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers. The results demonstrated that the combination of IDT and NT with appropriate spacers was a promising molecular design strategy for the application of solar cells . During the past decade , polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted extensive attention due to their lightweight , low cost and great potential for the fabrication of large - area flexible devices. 1-3 PSCs based on bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) architecture are of particular interests since high performance devices with power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) exceed 8% can be achieved. 4-9 Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor , and fullerene derivatives such as [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as the electron acceptor. 10,11 Generally , when considering that open circuit voltage ( V oc ) is related to the difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level of donor materials and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy level of acceptor , 12,13 deep HOMO levels for low band gap conjugated polymers are preferred in order to attain high V oc . However , lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap , and thereby the absorption of resulted polymers would have less overlap with solar spectrum , which are unfavorable for high short circuit current ( J sc ). To obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap so as to maximize the PCE , an intriguing approach involves incorporat - ing electron rich moieties ( donor , D ) and electron deficient moieties ( acceptor , A ) and alternating them on the backbone , which are so - called D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers.

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph can be identified as follows:

1. Indacenodithiophene (IDT)
2. Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)
3. Bithiophene
4. Dodecyl
5. (6,6)-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
6. (6,6)-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
7. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
8. [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)

These are the names of the materials used in the synthesis of the polymers and their components.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. Indacenodithiophene (IDT)
2. Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)
3. (6,6)-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)

These three entities are the names of materials used in the synthesis of the polymers.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities from the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Indacenodithiophene (IDT) |
| Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT) |
| (6,6)-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Three donor - acceptor type of narrow band gap conjugated polymers with enlarged coplanar skeleton were synthesized via Stille copolymerization of indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) based monomers. The energy levels , absorption spectra and band gaps of the resulting polymers were well tuned by utilizing different thiophene derivatives as spacer between IDT and NT units , and polymer PIDT-C12NT which employed bithiophene attached with dodecyl side chain as spacer exhibited superior properties compared to the other two copolymers. All polymers exhibited deep highest occupied molecular orbital energy levels and subsequently lead to high open circuit voltages of fabricated solar cell devices. Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers. The results demonstrated that the combination of IDT and NT with appropriate spacers was a promising molecular design strategy for the application of solar cells . During the past decade , polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted extensive attention due to their lightweight , low cost and great potential for the fabrication of large - area flexible devices. 1-3 PSCs based on bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) architecture are of particular interests since high performance devices with power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) exceed 8% can be achieved. 4-9 Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor , and fullerene derivatives such as [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as the electron acceptor. 10,11 Generally , when considering that open circuit voltage ( V oc ) is related to the difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level of donor materials and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy level of acceptor , 12,13 deep HOMO levels for low band gap conjugated polymers are preferred in order to attain high V oc . However , lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap , and thereby the absorption of resulted polymers would have less overlap with solar spectrum , which are unfavorable for high short circuit current ( J sc ). To obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap so as to maximize the PCE , an intriguing approach involves incorporat - ing electron rich moieties ( donor , D ) and electron deficient moieties ( acceptor , A ) and alternating them on the backbone , which are so - called D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. Identify the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

* Indacenodithiophene (IDT)
* Naphtho[1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)
* Bithiophene
* Dodecyl side chain
* (6,6)-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
* (6,6)-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
* [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
* [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
2. Identify the property names of the materials:

* IDT: HOMO energy level, band gap
* NT: HOMO energy level, band gap
* Bithiophene: spacer
* Dodecyl side chain: spacer
* PC71BM: electron acceptor, LUMO energy level
* PC61BM: electron acceptor, LUMO energy level
3. Identify the property values of the materials:

* IDT: deep HOMO energy level
* NT: deep HOMO energy level
* Bithiophene: high charge carrier mobility
* Dodecyl side chain: high charge carrier mobility
* PC71BM: high LUMO energy level
* PC61BM: high LUMO energy level
4. Identify the relationships between the materials and their properties:

* IDT and NT have deep HOMO energy levels, which are preferred for high open circuit voltage (Voc).
* Bithiophene and dodecyl side chain are used as spacers to tune the energy levels and band gaps of the resulting polymers.
* PC71BM and PC61BM are used as electron acceptors, and their LUMO energy levels are related to the open circuit voltage (Voc) of the solar cells.
* The combination of IDT and NT with appropriate spacers is a promising molecular design strategy for solar cells.
5. Identify the advantages and disadvantages of the materials:

* Advantages:
 + IDT and NT have deep HOMO energy levels, which are preferred for high open circuit voltage (Voc).
 + Bithiophene and dodecyl side chain can be used to tune the energy levels and band gaps of the resulting polymers.
 + PC71BM and PC61BM have high LUMO energy levels, which are related to the open circuit voltage (Voc) of the solar cells.
* Disadvantages:
 + Lowering the HOMO level of the polymers can result in a larger band gap, which can reduce the absorption of the polymers and unfavorable for high short circuit current (Jsc).
6. Identify the applications of the materials:

* The materials are used in the fabrication of bulk-heterojunction solar cells.
7. Identify the challenges and limitations of the materials:

* The challenge is to obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage (Voc) and band gap to maximize the power conversion efficiency (PCE).
* The limitation is that lowering the HOMO level of the polymers can result in a larger band gap, which can reduce the absorption of the polymers and unfavorable for high short circuit current (Jsc).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here's the updated list of entities that refer to the Property Name of Material:

1. HOMO energy level
2. LUMO energy level
3. band gap
4. open circuit voltage (Voc)
5. short circuit current (Jsc)

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to the Property Name of Material:

1. IDT
2. NT
3. bithiophene
4. dodecyl side chain
5. PC71BM
6. PC61BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities presented in the same words as in the original paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| HOMO energy level |
| LUMO energy level |
| band gap |
| open circuit voltage (Voc) |
| short circuit current (Jsc) |
